description: "Linear equations, matrices, determinants. Introduction to vector spaces and linear transformations and bases. Complex numbers. Eigenvalues and eigenvectors; diagonalization. Inner products and orthogonality; least squares problems. An emphasis on applications involving matrix and vector calculations."
detail: {"Chapter 2 - Systems of Linear Equations":{"SS":["Row Reduction to Echelon form","The Geometry of Linear Systems"]},"Chapter 1 - Vectors":{"SS":["Dot Product and Orthogonality","Lines and Planes","Vectors in Euclidean n-Space"]},"Chapter 3 - Matrices":{"SS":["Elementary matrices","Matrix inverse; and properties of matrices","Matrix operationss"]}}

description: "Riemann sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, definite, indefinite and improper integrals, approximate integration, integration techniques, applications of integration. First-order separable differential equations and growth models."
detail: {"Chapter 2 - Applications of Integration":{"SS":["Areas between Curves","Volumes"]},"Chapter 3 - Techniques of Integration":{"SS":["Integration by Parts","Trigonometric Integrals","Trigonometric Substitution"]},"Chapter 1 - Integrals":{"SS":["Areas and Distances","Substitution Rule","The Definite Integral"]}}

description: "Topics covered include graph theory, trees, inclusion-exclusion, generating functions, recurrence relations, and optimization and matching."
detail: {"Chapter 1 - Recurrence Relations":{"SS":["First-Order Linear Recurrence Relations","Nonhomogeneous Recurrence Relations"]},"Chapter 2 - Graph Theory":{"SS":["Planar Graphs","Vertex Degree: Euler Trails and Circuits"]},"Chapter 3 - Trees":{"SS":["Characterizations of Trees and Prufer Codes","Rooted Trees and Depth-First-Search Spanning Trees"]}}

description: "Introduction to counting, induction, automata theory, formal reasoning, modular arithmetic."
detail: {"Chapter 1 - Counting":{"SS":["Combination","Permutation"]},"Chapter 2 - Logic and Quantifiers":{"SS":["De Morgan's Laws","Logical Operations"]}}

description: "Logarithmic and exponential functions, trigonometric functions, inverse functions. Limits, continuity, and derivatives. Techniques of differentiation, including logarithmic and implicit differentiation. The Mean Value Theorem."
detail: {"Chapter 3 - Limits and Derivatives":{"SS":["Continuity","Limit of a Function","Tangent and Velocity Problems"]},"Chapter 2 - Functions and Models":{"SS":["Four ways to represent a function","Mathematical Models: A Catalogue of Essential functions","New Functions from Old Functions"]},"Chapter 1 - Differentiation Rules":{"SS":["Derivatives of Polynomials and Exponential Functions","Derivatives of Trigonometric Functions","Product and Quotient Rules"]}}
